result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quaveon Amuir Turner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quaveon Amuir Turner appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Quaveon Amuir Turner.  Attorney Jon Josephsen in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Amy E Spanczak.

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense counsel intends to file a motion to suppress.  Court ordered Defense to file motion by November 18, 2022 end of business day.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quaveon Amuir Turner in court in person.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court in person for Quaveon Amuir Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quaveon Amuir Turner in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney O'Reilly to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Quaveon Amuir Turner in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in coourt for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quaveon Amuir Turner in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case in court for initial appearance.  State requests an adjourned initial appearance to be held in person.  Court grants request.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in Room 503 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
